intro: Corispermum latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its seeds are encased in a hard, smooth shell and are dispersed by wind. Corispermum latifolium is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of soil salinity.
